intro: Erigeron higginsii, commonly known as the Higgins' fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It has silvery-gray foliage and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral ecosystems. Erigeron higginsii is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
